meanings.definition: to equip or control with transistors
meanings.sent1: Dad transistorises the old radio to make it work better.
meanings.sent2: The technician transistorises the circuit board for improved efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to transistorise itself with transistors but ended up with too many!
meanings.sent4: She transistorises her mind with positive thoughts to stay focused.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's wand seemed to transistorise reality itself, creating magical effects.

meanings.definition: the process of incorporating transistors into a device
meanings.sent1: The transistorises of the new computer were done meticulously.
meanings.sent2: Transistorises in modern electronics have revolutionized technology.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted in laughter when the teacher accidentally mixed up the transistorises of the robot.
meanings.sent4: The transistorises of innovation are evident in the sleek design of the smartphone.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece was a beautiful transistorises of colors and shapes.
